fields.summary: euca-deregister returns bogus error message when deregistering a malformed image ID

comments.body: Testing issue, and providing debugging output.

Confirmed. com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.cmd.DeregisterImage.main(DeregisterImage.java:60) {code}

Hi All,

May I please request a code review for :  EUCA-4869 euca-deregister returns bogus error message when deregistering a malformed image ID

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-4869

diff :  git show --color 4b3eed16cf39eaa057c87c736f1e816ce5131d3c

Summary:  When a user enters a malformed imageId i.e not "emi- | eki- | eri-" followed by 8 chars, the error is not 
          very user friendly and not consistent with AWS output. 
          
Solution: add a check for the regular expression "\(emi-|eki-|eri-\)\\\w\{8\}" if this returns false throw EucalyptusCloudException
          with an error message that is user friendly and more consistent with the AWS error output
 
Unit test : 

Run:  euca-deregister emi-1234567  (malformed imageId)

FAIL: DeregisterImageType: Get unique failed for ImageInfo using example: [ImageInfo imageName=null description=null architecture=null ....

PASS: DeregisterImageType: Invalid id: "emi-1234567"


I have created eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/Euca4869

[root@eucahost-51-81 precise]# euca-deregister blah
euca-deregister: error (DeregisterImageType): Invalid id: "blah"
[root@eucahost-51-81 precise]#
